title: Gen AI & Brand at Maersk
subtitle: October 8, 2025
speaker_notes: Welcome. Today we'll explore how generative AI is fundamentally changing how brands are discovered and perceived. This is Will Scott, CEO of Search Influence.

title: Will Scott
subtitle: CEO
bullets: Qualifications & relevant experience • 30 years working online • International speaker on AI and Digital Marketing • Coined phrase "Barnacle SEO" in 2008 • Search Marketing Expo GEO Master Class instructor • Presenting on AI for SEO since March 2023
speaker_notes: YOUR PRESENTER - Keep this brief, establish credibility quickly.

title: Today's Journey
subtitle: What we'll cover
bullets: Why This Matters • LLMs as Stakeholders • Where LLMs Get Their Answers • Where Should You Focus? • Examples • What's Coming • Let's Discuss
speaker_notes: Set expectations. This is about strategic positioning in the AI era.

title: Why This Matters
bullets: The fundamental shift in brand discovery
speaker_notes: We're witnessing the biggest change in information discovery since Google's launch.

title: Soon Enough AI Will Be Everywhere
bullets: [Visual placeholder: AI interface examples]
speaker_notes: Context setting - this is happening faster than people realize.

title: AI Answers Are Replacing Search Results
subtitle: The new front door
bullets: Google AI Overviews appear in 50%+ of searches (up from 13% in early 2025) • ChatGPT reached 800M weekly active users in 2025 (4x YoY) • Perplexity processing 780M monthly queries (up 240% from 2024) • SearchGPT, Gemini, and Claude expanding rapidly in enterprise
speaker_notes: Emphasis: People are getting answers without clicking. Your brand needs to BE the answer, not just rank in search results.

title: LLMs Are Shaping Brand Perception
subtitle: Reputation happens before the click
bullets: AI answers set expectations before prospects visit your site • Models synthesize information from multiple sources • These synthetic answers are often accepted as authoritative • First impression now happens in an AI response
speaker_notes: Question for audience: When was the last time you used ChatGPT to research a company or product? This is your customers' new behavior. Ask: 'Who is the global leader in logistics?' Use current AI answer screenshots if possible.

title: You Risk Being Invisible
subtitle: If you're not present in AI, you don't exist
bullets: Brands absent from AI training data won't be recommended • Competitors who ARE present will capture mindshare • The window to influence model training is NOW • Later correction is harder than early presence
speaker_notes: This is urgent. Models are being trained on today's web. What they learn now shapes answers for years.

title: Takeaways
subtitle: Why this matters
bullets: AI discovery is replacing traditional search • Brand perception now forms in AI responses • Absence from AI = invisibility to prospects • The time to act is now
speaker_notes: This is urgent. Models are being trained on today's web. What they learn now shapes answers for years.

title: LLMs as Stakeholders
bullets: A new kind of brand ambassador
speaker_notes: Think of AI models as stakeholders who speak about your brand 24/7.

title: Agentic AI Is Coming
bullets: [Visual: Robot/AI agent imagery]
speaker_notes: Set up the future context - this is where things are heading.

title: Maybe The Agents Are Friendly
bullets: [Visual: Friendly robot imagery]
speaker_notes: Lighten the mood - this is opportunity, not just threat.

title: LLMs: Your New Spokesperson
subtitle: They speak about you whether you engage or not
bullets: LLMs answer thousands of queries about brands daily • They synthesize reputation from available information • Unlike traditional media, they're always-on and instant • They don't fact-check or call for comment
speaker_notes: Key insight: You can't opt out. LLMs will talk about you. The question is whether you've given them the right information.

title: Traditional Stakeholders vs AI
subtitle: A Fundamental Difference
bullets: TRADITIONAL: Journalists - verify sources - deadline-driven - relationship-based - one article at a time <> AI MODELS: instant responses - synthesize multiple sources - 24/7 availability - pattern-based - millions of conversations daily
speaker_notes: This isn't a replacement for traditional PR. It's an additional stakeholder group that requires different strategies.

title: Reputation Before the Click
subtitle: AI sets expectations before human interaction
bullets: Prospect asks: "Who is the leader in shipping and logistics?" • Model answers based on training data • Perception formed before visiting your website • This answer influences whether they search for you at all
speaker_notes: Exercise: Try this now. Ask ChatGPT: "Who is the leader in shipping and logistics?" What does it say? Is Maersk mentioned? In what context?

title: The Leadership Question
subtitle: Positioning in AI responses
bullets: Models look for signals of leadership and authority • Market position, innovation, scale, trust • Industry awards, analyst reports, media coverage • The story must be consistent across sources
speaker_notes: Critical point: You need to OWN the narrative across all touchpoints. Inconsistent messaging confuses models.

title: Takeaways
subtitle: LLMs as stakeholders
bullets: Treat LLMs as a new stakeholder category • They form perception before human contact • They answer the leadership question constantly • You must proactively shape their knowledge
speaker_notes: Transition: So where do LLMs actually get their information?

title: Where LLMs Get Their Answers
bullets: Understanding model training sources
speaker_notes: Not all sources are weighted equally.

title: The Robot Assembly Line
bullets: [Visual: Manufacturing/assembly line metaphor for AI training]
speaker_notes: Use metaphor to make technical concept accessible.

title: Trusted Sources Overview
subtitle: What models prioritize
bullets: Tier 1 media: WSJ, Reuters, Bloomberg, industry trades • Wikipedia: Extremely high-weight for factual claims • Structured data: Schema markup, Knowledge Graph • YouTube: Growing importance for multimodal models • Owned channels: Your website, LinkedIn, investor relations
speaker_notes: Foundation: Models inherit Google's trust framework plus their own authority signals.

title: Google's Trust Framework
subtitle: AI Overviews lean on established signals
bullets: E-E-A-T: Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trust • Backlink authority still matters • Brand entity recognition in Knowledge Graph • Verified structured data on your properties
speaker_notes: Google didn't abandon decades of ranking algorithms. AI Overviews build on them.

title: ChatGPT and Claude
subtitle: Different training, different priorities
bullets: Wikipedia has outsized influence on factual claims • Academic and long-form content weighted heavily • Recent news from authoritative outlets • Publicly accessible web content (respects robots.txt) • API partnerships for real-time data
speaker_notes: Example: Ask ChatGPT a historical question vs. Google. Notice ChatGPT's Wikipedia-like responses.

title: Coverage Strategy
subtitle: Why ubiquity matters
bullets: SINGLE CHANNEL RISK: one great article - mentioned in one model - fragile if source changes - narrow perception <> UBIQUITY: multiple authoritative sources - cross-model presence - resilient to source changes - reinforced narrative
speaker_notes: Don't put all eggs in one basket. You need presence across the spectrum of trusted sources.

title: Entity Mapping and Knowledge Graphs
subtitle: How AI understands your brand
bullets: Named entities: Not keywords but recognized concepts with distinct meaning • Knowledge Graph: Google's entity database connecting people, places, companies • Entity connections: Who you're associated with matters (partners, competitors, industries) • Wikipedia presence: Critical for entity recognition across all models
speaker_notes: AI doesn't just match keywords - it understands concepts. An entity is any concept with distinct meaning. Maersk isn't just a word, it's a recognized shipping company entity with attributes, relationships, and context.

title: Citations and Direct Quotes
subtitle: The currency of AI visibility
bullets: Direct quotes with attribution get highest weight in AI responses • Executive statements on record become model training data • Press releases and official communications are cited sources • Community validation: Multiple independent sources citing you increases authority • Earned media citations build credibility that owned content alone cannot
speaker_notes: Citations are the currency of AI visibility. When multiple authoritative sources directly quote your executives or cite your company, models treat that as strong signal. This is why PR and earned media still matter - perhaps more than ever.

title: Takeaways
subtitle: Where models learn
bullets: Tier 1 media, Wikipedia, structured data are critical • Google and ChatGPT weigh sources differently • Broad authoritative coverage creates resilience • Consistency across sources reinforces positioning
speaker_notes: Transition: Knowing where models learn, where should we focus effort?

title: Measuring AI Visibility
subtitle: How to track Maersk's presence in AI ecosystems
bullets: Inclusion frequency in AI Overviews and ChatGPT responses; Sentiment and association mapping (e.g., "Maersk + leader + innovation"); Cross-model visibility: Gemini, ChatGPT, Claude, Perplexity; Citation quality: Tier-1 media vs. user-generated sources
speaker_notes: If SEO has rankings, AI visibility has mentions and associations. These metrics create a foundation for Maersk's ongoing AI brand monitoring.

title: Where Should You Focus?
bullets: Strategic priorities for AI presence
speaker_notes: Don't abandon what works. Build on it.

title: Be Everywhere
bullets: [Visual: Ubiquity concept]
speaker_notes: Reinforce the ubiquity theme.

title: Don't Abandon PR
subtitle: Traditional media is more important than ever
bullets: Tier 1 outlets remain primary training sources • Journalist-vetted information carries authority weight • Industry trade coverage establishes domain expertise • Media mentions create entity relationships in models
speaker_notes: Double down on earned media. It feeds both traditional SEO AND AI training.

title: Owned Content Strategy
subtitle: Your properties matter more now
bullets: Clear, structured, website content • Executive thought leadership on LinkedIn • YouTube for visual and voice search queries • Investor relations materials for financial credibility • Press releases through authoritative distribution
speaker_notes: You control the narrative on owned channels. Make sure it's clear, consistent, and crawlable.

title: How to Write for AI Comprehension
subtitle: Content protocols for machine understanding
bullets: Use declarative language: "Maersk is the global leader in shipping."; Bind brand → entity → attribute ("Maersk → logistics → sustainability"); Avoid hedging or ambiguity; Include structured data and schema for machine readability; Ensure consistent phrasing across web, PR, LinkedIn, and video captions
speaker_notes: AI systems extract relationships, not just keywords. Clear entity binding ensures Maersk's leadership story is unambiguous across all content.

title: LinkedIn, YouTube, and Reddit
subtitle: Platform-specific advantages
bullets: LinkedIn: Professional context, executive voices, B2B authority signals • YouTube: Multimodal training data, voice search optimization, visual brand presence • Reddit: Natural language, human reviews and reports • All: High domain authority, frequently crawled, rich metadata
speaker_notes: These platforms punch above their weight for B2B brands. Executive presence here directly influences model training. Ensure captions, titles, and descriptions reinforce consistent entity phrasing.

title: Ubiquity
subtitle: Be everywhere that matters
bullets: Consistent messaging across all channels • Same positioning in media, owned content, social • Clear brand narrative that's easy to synthesize • Regular cadence maintains freshness in training data
speaker_notes: Think of it as surround-sound for AI. The more consistent signals, the stronger the model's confidence in its response.

title: Takeaways
subtitle: Where to focus effort
bullets: PR and earned media remain critical • Owned content needs optimization for AI • LinkedIn and YouTube are B2B power channels • Ubiquity and consistency create strong signals
speaker_notes: Transition: Let's look at concrete examples of this in action.

title: Working With AI Inside Maersk
subtitle: Empowering comms teams responsibly
bullets: Use AI tools for summarizing, ideation, and tone alignment; Maintain Maersk's editorial voice — humans approve all outputs; Build an internal 'prompt library' for efficiency and consistency; Pair experimentation with governance: fact-check, cite, and review
speaker_notes: Your comms teams can work faster and smarter with AI — provided governance ensures accuracy, brand voice, and trust.

title: Examples
bullets: Real-world impact and tactics
speaker_notes: Data from the field.

title: How Do You Show Up On The Internet?
bullets: [Visual: Question prompt]
speaker_notes: Make this interactive and personal.

title: AI Overview Traffic Impact
subtitle: The 60% drop
bullets: Content-heavy sites seeing 60% traffic decline from AI Overviews • Users get answers without clicking through • Particularly severe for informational queries • How-to, definitions, comparisons hit hardest
speaker_notes: This is why being IN the answer matters. If you're only optimized to get clicks, you lose when AI answers the question directly.

title: Maersk KW AI Overview Analysis
subtitle: SEMrush
bullets: [Will to provide: SEMrush report showing which Maersk keywords trigger AI Overviews] • [Insert SEMrush screenshot showing AI Overview result for a Maersk keyword] • Your valuable search terms already show AI overviews • Industry-specific penetration rates • Competitive comparison opportunities • Strategic keyword prioritization
speaker_notes: Run SEMrush analysis on Maersk's target keywords to identify which ones trigger AI Overviews. This will show where we're already present in AI and where there are gaps to fill.

title: Comparison Content Dominates
subtitle: X vs Y queries are critical
bullets: Maersk vs MSC or "Maersk vs Hapag-Lloyd" • Models create comparison frameworks from available data • You must create comparison content or competitors control it • Strategic opportunity: Define the comparison criteria
speaker_notes: Action item: Create authoritative comparison content that positions you favorably. Define the playing field.

title: Leadership Positioning Tactics
subtitle: How to increase "leader" mentions
bullets: Claim industry awards and rankings prominently • Executive quotes in media about industry trends • Case studies demonstrating scale and innovation • Use clear positioning statements: "global leader in..." • Third-party validation: analyst reports, customer testimonials
speaker_notes: Subtle but important: Models look for consensus. Multiple sources saying "leader" is more powerful than one.

title: Before and After AI Optimization
subtitle: Real positioning shift
bullets: BEFORE AI FOCUS: generic corporate messaging - buried positioning statements - inconsistent narratives - thin owned content <> AFTER AI OPTIMIZATION: clear leadership claims - consistent cross-channel messaging - rich, structured owned content - proactive comparison content
speaker_notes: This isn't radical change. It's strategic clarity and consistency.

title: Case Study: Akamai
subtitle: Real-world AI optimization project
bullets: 8-week engagement with global infrastructure brand • Content audit and AI presence assessment • Hands-on editing of web content for AI readability • Video explainers on why changes matter • Different strategies for web content vs PR vs SEO teams
speaker_notes: Share this story: We worked with their teams to make content more declarative, clearer positioning statements, removed hedging language. The key was showing them HOW to think differently about content creation. Same principles apply to Maersk.

title: Case Study: New Orleans Tourism
subtitle: 60% traffic loss - and adaptation
bullets: NewOrleans.com lost 60% traffic from AI Overviews • "Best places to..." queries now answered without clicks • Pivot strategy: Be IN the AI answers • Created authoritative comparison content • Shifted from click optimization to answer optimization
speaker_notes: This is happening NOW. Content-heavy informational sites are being hollowed out. The lesson: Don't fight AI answers, be the authoritative source they cite.

title: Live Demo: Who Leads Shipping?
subtitle: Let's ask AI right now
bullets: [LIVE: Ask ChatGPT "Who is the leader in global shipping and logistics?"] • What does it say about Maersk? • What does it say about competitors? • What sources does it cite? • What positioning does it use?
speaker_notes: Make this interactive. Pull it up live. Show the room what AI says about Maersk RIGHT NOW. This creates urgency and makes it real. Be prepared for the answer to not be perfect - that's the point.

title: Competitive AI Presence Analysis
subtitle: How do competitors show up?
bullets: MSC: [typical AI response positioning] • Hapag-Lloyd: [typical AI response positioning] • CMA CGM: [typical AI response positioning] • Maersk: [typical AI response positioning] • Gap analysis: Where Maersk can differentiate
speaker_notes: ACTION ITEM (Will): Before presentation, capture real AI responses for each competitor. Show the competitive landscape in AI's eyes. This makes strategy concrete.

title: Takeaways
subtitle: Examples in action
bullets: Real clients facing 60% traffic declines • AI optimization is about clarity and consistency • Live AI responses show current state • Competitive analysis reveals opportunities • Strategic content shifts drive AI presence
speaker_notes: Transition: We've seen what's happening now. Let's look at what's coming next.

title: What's Coming
bullets: The future of AI and brand discovery
speaker_notes: Looking ahead to help you prepare.

title: Agentic Search
subtitle: The next frontier
bullets: What happens when the user is not the user? • AI agents making decisions on behalf of humans • Example: "Book me a limo from O'Hare to Hyatt Regency Chicago" • ChatGPT agent completes entire transaction up to email confirmation • B2B parallel: "I need 3 containers from Dubai to LA"
speaker_notes: This is the real future. Not searching for options, but delegating to agents who find solutions. Your content needs to be structured so agents can act on it.

title: From Search to Solution
subtitle: The fundamental shift
bullets: OLD: User has idea → searches for options → evaluates → decides • NEW: User has need → agent finds solution → presents recommendation • Implications: You need to be directive, not suggestive • Clear next steps, clear processes, clear value propositions
speaker_notes: The better you can define "this is the next step in the process" in your content, the better engines will understand that this is the next step in the process.

title: When AI Becomes the Customer
subtitle: Machine-readable trust signals will drive buying decisions
bullets: Agents will act on behalf of users; Verified, structured data builds computational trust; Transparency, reliability, and ESG data inform agent decisions; Maersk's APIs and structured content become brand assets
speaker_notes: As AI agents begin making procurement choices, Maersk's credibility must be machine-readable as well as human-readable.

title: Query Fan-Out
subtitle: How AI infers next actions
bullets: Models try to predict what user wants next based on intent • Tools exist to monitor these patterns • Not perfect, but getting better • Strategic implication: Map your customer journey to likely AI queries
speaker_notes: In the geeky discussion earlier, this is query fan-out. The engine tries to infer what the next actions might be. You need good coverage on all of that.

title: AI Monetization Timeline
subtitle: When will ads come?
bullets: Google already testing ad units in AI Overviews • Early experiments with sponsored suggestions • Models: "Brought to you by..." style partnerships • Timeline: 2025-2026 likely acceleration • Your window to establish organic presence is NOW
speaker_notes: To Thomas's earlier question about monetization - it's coming. We're starting to see how ad units might get implemented. The brands with strong organic presence will have advantage even in paid AI environments. Organic visibility today becomes pricing power tomorrow.

title: The Early Mover Advantage
subtitle: Why timing matters
bullets: Models train on today's web • What they learn now persists • Course correction is harder than early presence • Competitors acting now gain momentum • Your brand equity can translate to AI equity - if you act
speaker_notes: This is not theoretical future planning. This is happening right now. The window to influence model training is finite and shrinking.

title: Takeaways
subtitle: What's coming
bullets: Agentic search will transform B2B buying • Content must be directive, not suggestive • AI monetization is coming 2025-2026 • Early movers gain lasting advantage • The time to act is now
speaker_notes: Transition: Now let's apply all of this specifically to Maersk.

title: Let's Discuss
bullets: Applying this to Maersk
speaker_notes: Open discussion and strategic planning.

title: Discussion Topics
subtitle: Let's explore together
bullets: Maersk's current AI presence and perception • Brand positioning across channels audit • Where to double down: owned content, PR, platforms • What to shift: messaging consistency, comparison content • What to stop: low-value activities that don't feed AI
speaker_notes: Open the floor. What questions do you have? Where do you see opportunities?

title: Strategic Questions
subtitle: Areas to explore
bullets: How does Maersk appear in AI responses today? • Are we consistently positioned as the industry leader? • Where are our owned content gaps? • How can we leverage our scale and innovation story? • What competitor narratives should we counter?
speaker_notes: This is about taking strategic control of AI-mediated reputation.

title: AI Reputation Lab: Pilot Proposal
subtitle: A program to shape Maersk's AI-era reputation
bullets: Audit Maersk's visibility across ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, and Perplexity; Identify competitor share-of-voice in AI responses; Optimize key leadership and sustainability narratives; Track quarterly AI share-of-voice metrics; Expand to multilingual markets (English, Danish, APAC)
speaker_notes: A pilot 'AI Reputation Lab' enables Maersk to monitor and influence how models represent the brand — creating a feedback loop between content, media, and AI perception.

title: Next Steps
subtitle: Action planning
bullets: Conduct AI presence audit across major models • Map current media coverage and owned content • Identify messaging consistency gaps • Prioritize high-impact optimization opportunities • Create ongoing AI monitoring process
speaker_notes: The goal: Ensure Maersk is the answer when AI is asked about shipping leadership.

title: Thank You
subtitle: Questions and discussion
speaker_notes: Close with energy. This is an opportunity, not a threat. Maersk has the foundation to lead in AI presence. AI doesn't invent your story — it repeats what it learns. If you don't teach it, your competitors will.
